Ad Text:
About the Role

In this position, you will support the development, implementation, and continuous improvement of data governance frameworks and processes. You will provide specialist advice on data privacy, regulatory compliance, and risk mitigation while engaging with stakeholders across the organisation to uplift data maturity and support strategic decision-making.

Essential Criteria

Proven experience in data governance (5+ years), ideally within government or health sectors.

Strong understanding of Australian Government data policies, including the Data and Digital Government Strategy.

Demonstrated knowledge of information privacy and security, including the Privacy Act 1988, Freedom of Information principles, and the ability to interpret relevant legislation, policies, and standards.

Ability to manage complex stakeholder relationships and influence outcomes in a multi-disciplinary environment.

Clear understanding of data risks and the role data governance plays in mitigating these risks.

Demonstrated knowledge of best-practice data governance developed through Human Centred Design (HCD) or co-design approaches.

Excellent communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills.

Desirable Criteria

Experience working with Indigenous data governance frameworks or sensitive health data.

Knowledge of regulatory frameworks (e.g., NIST, data privacy standards) and experience designing solutions to certify compliance.

Experience with data governance tools, metadata management, and data cataloguing platforms.

Understanding of systems engineering with exposure to applications, analytics platforms, and related technologies.

Previous consulting or facilitation experience.

Location: Brisbane, QLD 

Remuneration/Benefit: Attractive remuneration plus clear career progression 

We’re looking for a passionate and ambitious finance professional to join our Network Finance and Regulation team in a permanent role. You’ll deliver sharp analysis, forward-looking planning, and accurate customer billing to help us lift performance across the business. You’ll guide commercial decisions with clear insights, oversee billing and reporting, and manage technical accounting matters with confidence.

You’ll also support and develop a committed team, making sure they have the tools and knowledge to deliver quality financial accounting and practical business advice. We want someone who’s eager to grow, keen to take on the next challenge, and ready to step into broader and more senior responsibilities as the team evolves.

Key accountabilities include:

Lead key financial processes, including period-end billing, invoicing, and related activities, ensuring they run efficiently and on time.
Lead the creation, review, and analysis of performance reports, ensuring data and insights are accurate, clear, and valuable to decision-makers.
Oversee and maintain smooth systems for billing below rail access revenues, tracking performance, and meeting all accounting and regulatory requirements.
Manage the billing and financial requirements of commercial agreements with care, ensuring they meet contractual and industry standards.
Provide timely, accurate analysis and advice to help monitor and improve business performance.
Assist in shaping pricing policies and initiatives, developing fair and effective ways to measure results

What you bring to the role:

Solid knowledge of financial systems and processes, with a focus on efficiency, accuracy, and maintaining high-quality, reliable data.
A strong understanding of modern financial accounting and modelling, with the ability to use these tools to guide important business decisions and support effective planning, reporting, and system use.
Confidence in producing, analysing, and presenting complex financial information in a clear and timely way, helping senior leaders make well-informed decisions.
A practical, solution-focused approach to problem-solving, with the ability to think creatively and analytically about commercial finance challenges

You’ll thrive if you:

Enjoy working closely with others to achieve shared goals.
Communicate clearly and with purpose.
Make thoughtful, balanced decisions that support progress and growth.

 What we offer you:      

At Aurizon, we support the development and growth of our employees. With a national portfolio of operations, we offer long-term and exciting career opportunities.
 

Some of our benefits include:

Development and growth opportunities.
Access to mentoring and development programs.
Discounts on selected health insurance funds, personal travel, gyms, vehicles and retail brands.
Parental leave program and super booster.

 

About Aurizon.

Aurizon is Australia’s largest rail freight operator and a top 100 ASX company. Each year, we deliver more than 250 million tonnes of Australian commodities right across the country. Aurizon is crucial to the Australian economy, connecting miners, primary producers and industry with international and domestic markets.

Look to Aurizon for a diverse and collaborative culture.

At Aurizon, we are proud of our diverse, collaborative, creative and high-performance culture. We celebrate the contribution of every employee and provide opportunities for career development in a dynamic, caring, and inclusive work environment.

To learn about us and our company values, please visit www.aurizon.com.au/careers

Job Title: Commercial Real Estate Senior Data Analyst
Ad Text:
About the Role You’ll support major transactions across Build-to-Rent, Student Accommodation, and Land Lease Communities, assisting in financial analysis, feasibility modelling, and marketing strategy for high-profile property assets. This role involves working closely with senior partners and agents on a diverse range of investment and development projects.

Key Responsibilities

Development feasibility and financial modelling
Market research, property analysis, and database management
Preparing marketing materials, submissions, and presentations
Supporting the national analyst team with strategic insights
Maintaining CRM systems and assisting with marketing campaigns
Skills & Experience

Bachelor’s degree in property, commerce, or a related field
4+ years’ experience in commercial real estate or valuations
Strong analytical and numerical skills with advanced Excel
Excellent communication and organisational skills
Estate Master experience highly regarded
What’s on Offer

Attractive salary plus bonus incentives
Collaborative, high-energy team environment
Ongoing professional development and clear career growth pathways
Modern Melbourne office with premium facilities and flexible work options
If you’re a driven property professional ready to take the next step in your commercial real estate career, we want to hear from you.All applications are handled with strict confidentiality.

Our Commitment to Diversity

At TRS Resourcing, we foster a diverse and inclusive workforce. We strongly encourage applications from women and Aboriginal/Torres Strait Islander candidates.

We're upfront, honest, and transparent in every job listing we post. When you see a role from us, you can trust it's an active opportunity.

Francesca Bennett
TRS Emerging Recruitment Consultant

#SCR-francesca-bennett

We’ve been trusted to serve Aussie communities since 1914 and grown to become a top 30-listed on the ASX with over 115,000 team members and a portfolio of iconic brands. At Coles Group, you’ll not only get to make a difference to millions of Aussie lives—you’ll also get to see your impact.

About the team

We have the ambition to become Australia's most sustainable supermarket.  As one of Australia’s leading companies we need to show the way forward. By acting together now, we can create a better Australia for future generations.

About the Role

We are seeking a Sustainability Data & Performance Manager to play a pivotal role in shaping our sustainability reporting and data governance framework. This is an exciting opportunity for a technical subject matter expert who thrives in the data and reporting space and is passionate about driving sustainability performance across a large, complex organisation.

You’ll also:

Consolidate sustainability data from multiple workstreams into a single source of truth
Maintain robust data governance processes, definitions, and quality controls
Ensure readiness of sustainability data for external reporting, verification, and assurance
Build dashboards, scorecards, and KPI tracking tools to monitor progress against sustainability commitments
Analyse data to generate actionable insights for program leads and senior stakeholders
Support the development of a sustainability audit framework aligned with evolving regulatory standards
Identify risks, gaps, and opportunities to improve data systems and reporting tools
Partner with senior managers and cross-functional teams to provide accurate, validated data for disclosures
Build trusted relationships across finance, risk, transformation, and data teams

About you and your skills

Our ideal candidate is a detail-oriented sustainability professional with a strong technical foundation in data and reporting. You thrive in complex environments and have a proven ability to consolidate and analyse data across multiple systems. You bring expertise in sustainability reporting frameworks and a passion for driving performance insights. Your auditing background gives you an edge in governance and assurance, and you’re comfortable building dashboards, managing data integrity, and translating complex metrics into actionable insights. Above all, you’re a collaborative partner who can engage stakeholders across the business and build trusted relationships to deliver meaningful sustainability outcomes.

You’ll also ideally have:

Tertiary qualification in Data Analytics, Sustainability, Environmental Management, or related field
Extensive experience in a sustainability advisory, consultancy, or within a large, complex environment
Previous experience in sustainability reporting and data management
Auditing background highly beneficial
Strong technical expertise in sustainability data and reporting frameworks (e.g., GRI, ISSB, TCFD)
Advanced data analysis and visualisation skills (dashboards, KPI frameworks, BI tools)
Ability to translate complex data into clear, actionable insights

What’s in it for you?

Flexible working options: We know that work is only one part of your life, so we actively encourage a positive work-life balance and provide hybrid working options to help you achieve it.
Office perks: Take advantage of our gym facility and fitness classes, free parking, BBQ area, mini-Coles supermarket, fooderie hub where you can sample new products before they hit the shelves, school holiday program and so much more when you come in.
Discounts: Eligible team members receive 5% discount all year round on your Supermarket and Liquor online and in-store purchases. We also offer additional periods of double discount (10%) at various times throughout the year. As well as hotdeals exclusive to team members that translate into additional savings.
Reward through recognition: Give and receive recognition, linked to our Coles values, through our digital recognition platform ‘mythanks’. You can accumulate points to redeem in the online shop for exciting gifts and electronic gift cards from an extensive range of retailers.
Opportunities for learning and development: No matter where you start within our diverse business, you’ll have experiences, exposure, and education to satisfy you. Discover and explore a variety of career development programs and job-specific training.
Paid parental leave: We understand how important your life outside work is and offer permanent team members paid parental leave to support you in balancing work and family.
Investment in your future: Our annual team member share plan offer allows eligible team members to make regular pre-tax salary sacrifice deductions to purchase Coles Group shares.

About the recruitment process

We’re continuing to build a gender equitable team, and a culture that is just as diverse, inclusive and welcoming as the communities we serve. We are committed to creating a workplace that is safe and respectful for our team. We encourage applications from people of all ages, cultures (including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples), abilities, sexual orientation and gender identities.

We’re happy to adjust our recruitment process to support candidates with disability. For further information and additional contact details visit the ‘Our Recruitment Process’ section of our careers site or email inclusionrecruitment@coles.com.au

Job ID: 172829

Employment Type: Full time

Category:
Management (Information & Communication Technology)
Government - State (Government & Defence)
Ad Text:
Your key responsibilities:

Develop and manage strategic business relationships and an intake process that will enable customers to find appropriate solutions for their priority ICT and digital business needs.
Using influence and effective stakeholder engagement strategies, partner with divisions to define and execute ICT and digital line of business and enterprise strategies.
Manage a business analysis program of work, including prioritisation, resource allocation and increased maturity of business analysis practice within DoJ.
Position the team as the strategic partner for customers with respect to ICT and digital, developing and maintain resilient proactive partnerships with customers, acting as an escalation point for the team when required.
Undertake day-to-day management of the Strategic Business Engagement team by setting KPIs and performance metrics, monitoring performance and taking corrective action to ensure that outcomes are delivered.

Technical skills, abilities and cultural capability:

Detailed knowledge of information technology management, practices, and trends.
Working knowledge of business analysis, portfolio project management and related information systems.
Analyse and evaluate information from multiple sources, define the problem or opportunity, summarise and present the key themes to various audiences.
Work on multiple projects simultaneously and adjust priorities quickly as circumstances dictate.
Establish and maintain working relationships with team and internal and external stakeholders.
Manage team through sound guidance, coaching and empowerment.

Applications to remain current for 12 months.

Job Ad Reference: QLD/670566/25

Closing Date: Monday, 1st December 2025

About us
At DPC, you'll be part of a team that leads and connects the public sector, delivering outstanding advice and services that impact Queensland's future. It's in your hands.

The Implementation Division is responsible for driving delivery of the government's key priorities and partnering across government to ensure impactful and measurable
outcomes on a range of policy problems.

How you'll contribute
As Principal Advisor in the Data Intelligence team, you will drive the use of advanced analytics and data insights to inform strategic decision-making and deliver measurable outcomes for Queensland Government priorities.

In this dynamic and impactful role, you'll make your mark by:
• Designing and delivering innovative analytics, visuals, and data narratives to support strategic initiatives.
• Collaborating with senior leaders and partners to embed data insights into policy and program design.
• Building sustainable methodologies and capabilities to enhance analytical maturity across agencies.
• Preparing high-quality submissions, briefs, and data insights for diverse audiences

Please note occasional travel throughout Queensland is a part of this role.

What you'll bring to the role
You'll draw on your extensive expertise in advanced analytics, data visualization and storytelling to translate complex data into clear, compelling insights and recommendations.

We're seeking someone who thrives in dynamic environments, excels at managing complexity, and takes ownership of their work. You'll bring strong professional connections, exceptional communication, negotiation, and stakeholder management skills.

If you're adaptable, outcome-driven, and thrive in an ecosystem framework, we'd love to hear from you. Please note recruitment of the AO7 Senior Advisor, Data Intelligence is occurring simultaneously. Applicants are encouraged to consider which role may be best suited to their current experience.

Eligibility
To be eligible for this role, you must have the right to work in Australia.

Why join us
At DPC, you'll be part of a team that leads and connects the public sector, delivering outstanding advice and services that impact Queensland's future. It's in your hands.

How to apply
To apply for this role, 
1. submit your tailored resume highlighting your relevant work experience
2. complete a set of questions via the Smart Jobs application form detailing your proficiency in Power BI and Excel, outlining your experience and highlighting the unique strengths you bring to this role.

Further information on the responsibilities of the role is found in the role description. You are strongly encouraged to review the applicant guide prior to applying.
DPC is committed to working with you to discuss adjustments to ensure you can best demonstrate your suitability for the role.

If you would like to discuss the role or would like additional support/adjustments during recruitment, please contact Shady Botros, Director, Data Intelligence, Implementation Division, on 07 3003 9282 or shady.botros@premiers.qld.gov.au.

 

Applications to remain current for 12 months

Job Ad Reference: QLD/670493/25

Closing Date: Monday, 1st December 2025
